ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_rainbow] Re: computer questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Extra ram will help on any graphic application.  Personally I have a pIII 450 with 256 ram.  I also noticed the frame rate problem in Kunark (often referred to
ygData.messageBody:
Extra ram will help on any graphic application. Personally I have a pIII 450 with 256 ram. I also noticed the frame rate problem in Kunark (often referred to as "lag" by many people), and bought a Creative Labs Anihilator Pro - one of the best 3d cards on the market. I had too many problems with voodoo cards and will never go back.

-Linn

-----Original Message-----
From: Melanie [SMTP:Mpatient1@...]
Sent: Monday, July 24, 2000 3:18 PM
To: EQ_rainbow@egroups.com
Subject: [EQ_rainbow] Re: computer questions

no authority here, but I would say upgrade you RAM first...that is
major factor in zoneing times. then either video or sound, whichever
you think is more important (I would go video) as far as lag I have
noticed a lot more lately too, so it's not just you :o)

Ompa




--- In EQ_rainbow@egroups.com, "Todd Morris" <GaybirderSF@c...> wrote:
> OK, I'm one of those that can turn it on & run it, but don't know
a
> thing about what's inside. I THINK mine has an AMD whatever chip --
> 550 thingies if I remember correctly. I know the 3D whats-it is one
> that's either not actually listed for EQ, or is buried deep in the
> compatability list on the main site -- not one listed right on the
> Kunark box, at any rate. Same for the sound card. I also have 64
RAM,
> & a 56k modem. I have no norrathly idea how far I am from my isp,
or
> even how to find that out. Oh, the comp itself is a Compaq Presario
> something-or-other.
>
> SOOooo... what piece of this should I look to upgrade 1st in
order
> to get better run of EQ? I think most of you know I am the slowest
> zoner in the guild, & lately I've been having worse problems with
lag
> & ld than usual (which may be isp-load related & not something I
can
> upgrade, but I don't know). This is death for a bard, & making it
> really tough to twist songs. I just bought the comp 2 months ago,
but
> could upgrade some piece, I think. Can't switch isp, since I got a
> discount for signing up with them for 3 years.
>
> Thanks for any helpful advice!
>
> Todd (aka Snapdragyn & Gaistyd)
